title: Permanently banned for banter between friends
body:
So about 2 weeks ago I was permanently banned because of an audit of toxic logs in my team chat (link to it at the end). Yes it is true that the logs on their own clearly appear to be toxic but I was speaking to my IRL friends in a 5 man normal lobby in team chat, I was in a Skype call with all of them but my microphone was not working properly so I could only hear them and responded to them via text in team chat. Their names were Mcgoogles, Lightning Saix, jasonpwn, and Upwaft75. **All 4 of them have posted on this thread confirming the situation I described.**

Lyte has said himself that he is ok with banter amongst friends: "we've talked a lot in the past about how we're OK with players bantering with their friends"  which I will link

https://ask.fm/RiotLyte/answers/132485638338

EDIT: It was the enemy team that reported me, despite me speaking only in team chat to my friends

http://link.email.riotgames.com/YesConnect/HtmlMessagePreview?I67FcEeiZ%2BJ%2BYPf3iBbC6gaN01kOII4IEwlLpYQ3Nhw=.enc&msgVersion=web

Like, I said, it doesn't matter at all if there were other games as long as the game quoted as evidence was part of what tipped the system over the edge/threshold (which is certainly the case given the chat log and his previous account status). Would a cop be ethical in planting evidence because he's doing it to a "bad guy?" Past actions have literally zero bearing on the morality of using false evidence against someone. It is never fair for a false report to count against you, regardless of past behavior. Think of it like having one beer before driving (assuming it is under the legal limit). Your reaction time is probably still worse but infinitesimally so and you're not much of a worse driver. Now, if someone injects you with additional alcohol, puts you over the legal limit and then gets you arrested, would that be moral? Let's say that if you didn't drink at all before that, the alcohol injection isn't enough to get you in trouble.

Regardless of what he did in the past, his account status was not in question and we got that chat as evidence for why it is now banned. It's pretty obvious that it's grossly unethical to punish people for what they didn't do and if the threshold for a ban is met/moved closer to by a false report, that is not a justified ban. If the OP's chat wasn't used as part of the investigation, then it should not be provided as "evidence" and he should not be banned until legitimate evidence is presented.

BTW: While not really relevant here, the fact that false reports eventually get lower weighting doesn't mean that they start out that way. The first few false reports likely have equal weighting to that of any other player. Moreover, if someone makes false reports only very infrequently (perhaps out of spite against someone), the system probably won't flag them as someone with a low report weighting because it's not an established pattern of behavior. This is why it's important to have independent verification and a fair trial.
